div.bibl: Denní Hlasatel, Feb. 13, 1920. REPORT OF CZECH MEMBER OF SCHOOL BOARD

body.p: Mr. James B. Režný, a well-known Bohemian architect, at present a member of the Chicago Board of Education, announced that at the last meeting of the Board of Education held Wednesday afternoon, it was decided to make some improvements on the buildings of the Robert Burns School, 2524 South Central Park Avenue. The school is attended mostly by children of Bohemian parentage. The expense shall not exceed the sum of $14,000.
